column1: The person does not have a full-blown psychotic disorder, such as schizophrenia.
The disorder appears to be more common in families with psychotic disorders, such as schizophrenia and delusional disorder.
Treatment is difficult because people with this condition are often very suspicious of doctors.
If treatment is accepted, talk therapy and medicines can often be effective.
Talk therapy and medicines can sometimes reduce paranoia and limit its impact on the person's daily functioning.
